issue.title: NEXT-00000 - Changed typo in image gallery config
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Shopware! Please fill out this description template to help us to process your pull request.

Please make sure to fulfil our contribution guideline (https://developer.shopware.com/docs/resources/guidelines/code/contribution?category=shopware-platform-dev-en/contribution).

Do your changes need to be mentioned in the documentation?
Please create a second pull request at https://github.com/shopware/docs
-->

### 1. Why is this change necessary?


### 2. What does this change do, exactly?
Changed `enitiy` to `entity`

### 3. Describe each step to reproduce the issue or behaviour.


### 4. Please link to the relevant issues (if any).


### 5. Checklist

- [x] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [ ] I have written tests and verified that they fail without my change
- [x] I have created a [changelog file](https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/trunk/adr/2020-08-03-implement-new-changelog.md) with all necessary information about my changes
- [ ] I have written or adjusted the documentation according to my changes
- [ ] This change has comments for package types, values, functions, and non-obvious lines of code
- [x] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 38f08b7</samp>

This pull request fixes a typo in the `entity` property of the image gallery element config in the administration module. This typo prevented the selection of media items for the image gallery element in the CMS. The fix affects the JavaScript and Twig files of the element config and adds a changelog entry.

<!--
copilot:walkthrough
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 38f08b7</samp>

* Fix typo in `entity` property of image gallery element config ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3364/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-3b8c60d49809fb5621c1b89916f24eb16c00760509c899e8d08a57a045fe647dL25-R25), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3364/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-1f11ed50c0dc9eca6f7228bd20d9b86d54519837dcb04adbfd84d356f511d7e1L61-R61))
* Add changelog entry for the typo fix ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3364/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-ba7aa960c7acfb00a08b4a306569cfc68b6c96de5aed55f3f4cbd91bfc2c38e1R1-R11))

issue.title: CustomField type "textfield" should not strip tags
issue.body:
### PHP Version

8.2

### Shopware Version

6.5.6.0

### Expected behaviour

in a customField of type "Text" I would expect that nothing will be stripped.

### Actual behaviour

currently if I enter for example

`<1g`

the field is emptied by the sanitzer

### How to reproduce

- create a customfield of type text
- create a product and enter '<1g' in that field
- the systems throws an error "Field XY is required"


the problem is this code in the `AbstractFieldSerializer` which uses strip_tags if the field is not a Html-Textfield
```
 if (!$field->is(AllowHtml::class)) {
            return strip_tags((string) $data->getValue());
        }
```

comment.body:
We found the following existing issues which may help or are related to your topic: 
- [Custom Field of type text-editor are not shown if no label is set](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-9669)
- [BUGFIX: If customFields is null this will cause an exception, therefore we need to fall back to an array value.](https://github.com/shopware/platform/issues/1561)
- [Wrong type return on checking customField payload value](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-13362)
- ["customFields.custom_xyz" Label-Snippets werden beim Speichern eines customFields nicht aktualisert](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-11248)
- [Customfields of type text/html can't be used in sorting](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-31074)
- [Field Serialization does not allow < char](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-25187)
- [Add missing CustomFieldTypes constants](https://github.com/shopware/platform/issues/1395)
- [Fix bulk edit: when empty custom fields is passed, it wipes out ALL custom fields](https://github.com/shopware/platform/issues/3075)
- [Fix bulk edit: when empty custom fields is passed, it wipes out ALL custom fields](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-27562)
- [Text snippets for custom field labels not removed on app uninstall](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-24023)

issue.title: CustomField type "textfield" should not strip tags
issue.body:
### PHP Version

8.2

### Shopware Version

6.5.6.0

### Expected behaviour

in a customField of type "Text" I would expect that nothing will be stripped.

### Actual behaviour

currently if I enter for example

`<1g`

the field is emptied by the sanitzer

### How to reproduce

- create a customfield of type text
- create a product and enter '<1g' in that field
- the systems throws an error "Field XY is required"


the problem is this code in the `AbstractFieldSerializer` which uses strip_tags if the field is not a Html-Textfield
```
 if (!$field->is(AllowHtml::class)) {
            return strip_tags((string) $data->getValue());
        }
```

pull_request.title: NEXT-00000 - Use non arbitrary product search index info
pull_request.body: ### 1. Why is this change necessary? The product indexing info is not reliable. Currently it just requests the first indexing item. "First" means just sorted by id. When we have uuidv7 it should even be the first one to be indexed be the "Rebuild search index" step. If you now rebuild search index and close the browser window you get the info of the current date time of the last indexing and still most of the products can't be found using the search because the search is not ready. ### 2. What does this change do, exactly? Use an aggregation of min and max createdAt instead of choosing the first indexing item's createdAt and using sw-time-ago for a human readable rendering At least you now know you need a full indexing after you changed settings. ### 3. Describe each step to reproduce the issue or behaviour. Abort indexing or just have a product update of the "first" product and immediately the info is a lie. ### 4. Checklist - [x] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts - [ ] I have written tests and verified that they fail without my change - [x] I have created a [changelog file](https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/trunk/adr/2020-08-03-implement-new-changelog.md) with all necessary information about my changes - [ ] I have written or adjusted the documentation according to my changes - [ ] This change has comments for package types, values, functions, and non-obvious lines of code - [x] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them. ### 🤖 Generated by Copilot at db48881 This pull request enhances the search index component in the `sw-settings-search` module by using aggregations instead of sorting to get the latest product search keywords, and by showing a more informative and user-friendly time range of the last index build. It also updates the changelog and the template accordingly. ### 🤖 Generated by Copilot at db48881 * Add a changelog entry for the feature of showing non-arbitrary product search index info ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3382/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e6929ddb8fdc104190f869ae48b8e4705251786b15159c14fe101b584d842064R1-R8)) * Refactor the `sw-settings-search-search-index` component to use aggregations instead of sorting to get the first and last dates of the product search keywords ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3382/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-be0fc1cf6f4dcfaa83eb2dae1447f281aade76c49cdb21c9fdf9efcc79b47862L33-R33), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3382/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-be0fc1cf6f4dcfaa83eb2dae1447f281aade76c49cdb21c9fdf9efcc79b47862L54-R57), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3382/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-be0fc1cf6f4dcfaa83eb2dae1447f281aade76c49cdb21c9fdf9efcc79b47862L91-R86)) * Adjust the template of the `sw_settings_search_search_index_lastest_build` block to display the time range of the latest index using the `sw-time-ago` component, or a fallback message if the index is empty ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3382/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-d2780cb530020eda160018126a9df252538befac1e59a49a20ed0550efea6f72L53-R58))

issue.title: Add administration watch socks config
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to Shopware! Please fill out this description template to help us to process your pull request.

Please make sure to fulfil our contribution guideline (https://developer.shopware.com/docs/resources/guidelines/code/contribution?category=shopware-platform-dev-en/contribution).

Do your changes need to be mentioned in the documentation?
Please create a second pull request at https://github.com/shopware/docs
-->

### 1. Why is this change necessary?
If the dev server for administration is started in a container, the suitable host and port must be specified for SOCKS, otherwise it tries to query `devServer.host`.

### 2. What does this change do, exactly?
You can now specify a SOCKS host and port. 
Just set `SOCKHOST` and/or `SOCKPORT`

### 3. Describe each step to reproduce the issue or behaviour.
If the dev server for administration is started in a container, the socks connection tries to connect to `devServer.host` which in this case is 0.0.0.0:443, that doesn't work because my container is only available over a dev domain.

### 4. Please link to the relevant issues (if any).


### 5. Checklist

- [x] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [ ] I have written tests and verified that they fail without my change
- [x] I have created a [changelog file](https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/trunk/adr/2020-08-03-implement-new-changelog.md) with all necessary information about my changes
- [ ] I have written or adjusted the documentation according to my changes
- [x] This change has comments for package types, values, functions, and non-obvious lines of code
- [x] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 6d44081</samp>

This pull request enhances the `webpack.config.js` file for the administration app by allowing developers to configure the dev server host and port. It also updates the changelog with a new entry for this feature.

<!--
copilot:walkthrough
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 6d44081</samp>

*  Add sockHost and sockPort options to webpack dev server configuration ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3395/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-495341c5724904c9afc2b8d581fab247a0eece8db8bbc18659bc2a49f9ef196cR578-R579))
* Fix minor formatting issues in `webpack.config.js` ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3395/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-495341c5724904c9afc2b8d581fab247a0eece8db8bbc18659bc2a49f9ef196cL38-R38), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3395/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-495341c5724904c9afc2b8d581fab247a0eece8db8bbc18659bc2a49f9ef196cL262-R274), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3395/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-495341c5724904c9afc2b8d581fab247a0eece8db8bbc18659bc2a49f9ef196cL827-R829))
* Create a new changelog entry for the feature ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3395/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-549b81d35a1c857943905635932883f90623aa3a7eec4b5d20c871f6c1a48348L1-R7))

issue.title: Minor README.md error - Mentions Symfony 6.2 but 6.3 is now used.

labels.name: Good first issue
labels.description: Good Issue for your first contribution or experimenting with Shopware

issue.body:
### PHP Version

8.2

### Shopware Version

6.5.5.1

### Expected behaviour

Correct Symfony version is referenced in README.md


### Actual behaviour

Wrong Symfoyn version is used in README.md

### How to reproduce

check https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/v6.5.5.1/README.md first sentence. might also be the case for other files.

did not check if the vue.js version is correct.

comment.body:
hey @tushar-nath 

maybe we can skip the minor version at all? :thinking: 

With Shopware 6.6 we will upgrade to Symfony 7, so this needs to be changed again. But I guess it would be sufficient to only state the major version of the used frameworks

issue.title: update README.md content to be more informative
issue.body:
### 1. Why is this change necessary?

The current readme contains a lot of marketing information that is better suited for the website, not a technical readme.

### 2. What does this change do, exactly?

As a first step, this update declutters the content of the readme and focuses more on it being a guideline for how to interact with the software and community.

### 5. Checklist

- [x ] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [x ] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

repo.name: shopware
repo.description: Shopware 6 is an open commerce platform based on Symfony Framework and Vue and supported by a worldwide community and more than 1.500 community extensions

issue.title: Minor README.md error - Mentions Symfony 6.2 but 6.3 is now used.

labels.name: Good first issue
labels.description: Good Issue for your first contribution or experimenting with Shopware

issue.body:
### PHP Version

8.2

### Shopware Version

6.5.5.1

### Expected behaviour

Correct Symfony version is referenced in README.md


### Actual behaviour

Wrong Symfoyn version is used in README.md

### How to reproduce

check https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/v6.5.5.1/README.md first sentence. might also be the case for other files.

did not check if the vue.js version is correct.

comment.body: @mitelg - Hello! Do I need to update the symfony version from 6.2 to 6.3 in the README.md file? I would like to take up this issue and make a PR on this.

issue.title: update README.md content to be more informative
issue.body:
### 1. Why is this change necessary?

The current readme contains a lot of marketing information that is better suited for the website, not a technical readme.

### 2. What does this change do, exactly?

As a first step, this update declutters the content of the readme and focuses more on it being a guideline for how to interact with the software and community.

### 5. Checklist

- [x ] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [x ] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

copilot:summary

copilot:walkthrough

comment.body:
Fails
:no_entry_sign: The title `update README.md content to be more informative` does not match our requirements. Example: NEXT-00000 - My Title
Warnings
:warning: The Pull Request doesn't contain any changelog file

issue.title: BugFix: Issue 3390 - Update data type for AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::getItems()
issue.body:
### 1. Why is this change necessary?

>  - Expected behaviour
> AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::getItems() should return array of Shopware\Core\Checkout\Cart\LineItem\LineItem or the return type of getItems() should be changed to Array of Arrays.
> 
>  - Actual behaviour
> AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::getItems() returns an array of array.

### 2. What does this change do, exactly?

- This change updates the return type of AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::getItems()

### 3. Describe each step to reproduce the issue or behaviour.

1. Add a Subscriber for AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent.

2. Subscriber should call AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::getItems()
  `class LineItemQuantityChangedSubscriber implements EventSubscriberInterface
  {
  public static function getSubscribedEvents(): array
  {
  return [
  AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent::class => 'onLineItemQuantityChange'
  ];
  }

    public function onLineItemQuantityChange(AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent $event): void
    {
    foreach ($event->getItems() as $itemToUpdate) {
    $lineItem->getPayload();
    }
    }
    }`

3. Change Qty in Cart.

4. Error appears cannot call getPayload() on array

### 4. Please link to the relevant issues (if any).

Issue - [[3390](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/issues/3390)]

### 5. Checklist

- [x] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [x] I have written tests and verified that they fail without my change
- [x] I have created a [changelog file](https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/trunk/adr/2020-08-03-implement-new-changelog.md) with all necessary information about my changes
- [x] I have written or adjusted the documentation according to my changes
- [x] This change has comments for package types, values, functions, and non-obvious lines of code
- [x] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

<!--
copilot:summary
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 4f80101</samp>

Modified the `AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent` class to include more details about the line items and their quantity changes. This allows event subscribers to access and use more information about the cart changes triggered by the event.

<!--
copilot:walkthrough
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at 4f80101</samp>

*  Change the type of the `items` property and parameter in the `AfterLineItemQuantityChangedEvent` class to store additional information about the line items ([link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3392/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e68124f4e953667c814feaf94a9dd3d7926aef68fd080d6a2dcec1231ccd7223L16-R16), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3392/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e68124f4e953667c814feaf94a9dd3d7926aef68fd080d6a2dcec1231ccd7223L31-R31), [link](https://github.com/shopware/shopware/pull/3392/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-e68124f4e953667c814feaf94a9dd3d7926aef68fd080d6a2dcec1231ccd7223L49-R49))

issue.title: NEXT-30650 - Fix custom field rules
issue.body:
- add missing properties to custom field rules

<!--
Thank you for contributing to Shopware! Please fill out this description template to help us to process your pull request.

Please make sure to fulfil our contribution guideline (https://developer.shopware.com/docs/resources/guidelines/code/contribution?category=shopware-platform-dev-en/contribution).

Do your changes need to be mentioned in the documentation?
Please create a second pull request at https://github.com/shopware/docs
-->

### 1. Why is this change necessary?

Custom field rules are not working. See more in the issue ticket [NEXT-30650](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-30650)

### 2. What does this change do, exactly?

- Adding missing properties to OrderCustomFieldRule and CustomerCustomFieldRule
- Adjusts the method "getConstraints" of the LineItemCustomFieldRule class so it is analog to the other customFieldRules


### 3. Describe each step to reproduce the issue or behaviour.

1. open the backend > settings > rule builder
2. create new rule
3. select a "customer with custom field" condition
4. try to save the new rule

### 4. Please link to the relevant issues (if any).

[NEXT-30650](https://issues.shopware.com/issues/NEXT-30650)

### 5. Checklist

- [x] I have rebased my changes to remove merge conflicts
- [ ] I have written tests and verified that they fail without my change
- [x] I have created a [changelog file](https://github.com/shopware/platform/blob/trunk/adr/2020-08-03-implement-new-changelog.md) with all necessary information about my changes
- [ ] I have written or adjusted the documentation according to my changes
- [x] This change has comments for package types, values, functions, and non-obvious lines of code
- [ ] I have read the contribution requirements and fulfil them.

copilot:summary

copilot:walkthrough
